comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This is George V of England, who traveled to India in December 1911 to be installed as King-Emperor of India. As a keen and expert shot, he was anxious for a hunting trip. After the ceremony in Delhi, he went north to Nepal. See anulib.anu.edu.au/subjects/ap/digilib/sasia/tig/tig_about... for more about the hunt and dspace.anu.edu.au/manakin/handle/1885/43307 for a picture of the king mounting what appears to be the same elephant. Also see a Dec 23, 1911 dispatch from London in the NYT: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B0CE1D81E31E233A...

comment._content: Thanks for the information and for citing your sources.  We’ll look into it.
